identificationModule.briefTitle: Dual Site-dual Channel Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for Motor Function in Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Dual Site-dual Channel Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for Recovery of Motor Function in Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to investigate the effect of dual site-dual channel non-invasive brain stimulation for recovery of motor function in post stroke patients. Simultaneous dual site-dual channel stimulation was applied by using two sets of transcranial direct current stimulation devices. All subjects will go through three conditions of transcranial direct current stimulation with for 30 minutes. Three conditions are 1) Dual stimulation 1: i) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex, ii) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional premotor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional supraorbital area. 2) Dual stimulation 2: i) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex, ii) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional anterior intraparietal sulcus and cathodal stimulation on contralesional supraorbital area. 3) Single stimulation: anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex.

armGroups.label: Dual Stimulation 1
armGroups.description: i) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex, ii) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional premotor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional supraorbital area.

armGroups.label: Dual Stimulation 2
armGroups.description: i) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex, ii) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional anterior intraparietal sulcus and cathodal stimulation on contralesional supraorbital area.

armGroups.label: Single stimulation
armGroups.description: anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex

interventions.name: M1 stimulation
interventions.description: stimulating primary motor cortex with anodal transcranial direct current stimulation

interventions.name: PMC stimulation
interventions.description: stimulating premotor cortex with anodal transcranial direct current stimulation

interventions.name: aIPS stimulation
interventions.description: stimulating anterior intraparietal sulcus with anodal transcranial direct current stimulation

interventions.name: hand motor task
interventions.description: hand motor task for 30 minutes during transcranial direct current stimulation

primaryOutcomes.description: measure the motor threshold and amplitude of motor evoked potential in first dorsal interosseous muscle.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: changes in nine hole peg test
secondaryOutcomes.description: Nine-Hole Peg Test is used to measure finger dexterity in patients with various neurological diagnoses.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: changes in grip and tip pinch strength test
secondaryOutcomes.description: measure the hand strength (grip and tip pinch)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: changes in box and block test
secondaryOutcomes.description: box and block test measures unilateral gross manual dexterity

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in brain activation of resting-state functional MRI

secondaryOutcomes.description: Cortical activation is measured by functional Near-Infrared-Spectroscopy (fNIRS) (NIRScout, NIRx, Germany)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* unilateral hemiplegic stroke patient
* Fugl Meyer Assessment score between 9 to 84

Exclusion Criteria:

* difficult to understand experimental tasks because of extremely severe cognitive impairment
* history of psychiatric disease
